alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:22PM MDT until June 29 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT FOR SOUTHERN GOSHEN...NORTHEASTERN LARAMIE AND SOUTHEASTERN PLATTE COUNTIES... At 421 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 14 miles southeast of Chugwater, or 32 miles north of Cheyenne, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Meriden Rest Area around 455 PM MDT. Hawk Springs Campground and Hawk Springs Recreation Area around 505 PM MDT. La Grange around 510 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 29 and 58. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
